    Scheduler
    public class DynamicScheduler
extends java.lang.Object
implements Scheduler
    Provides a more dynamic solution with generating a schedule

      Assigns current day a set of SubTasks
      boolean correctSchedule​(java.util.List<Day> schedule, int errorCount)
      Corrects schedule by eliminating all overflows via adjusting number of hours per day NOTE: This assumes that past days are stored in an archived list (thus, the first index of schedule is for today)

    • Method Detail

      • assignDay

        public int assignDay​(Day day,
                     int errorCount,
                     java.util.PriorityQueue<Task> complete,
                     java.util.PriorityQueue<Task> taskManager)
        Description copied from interface: Scheduler
        Assigns current day a set of SubTasks
        Specified by:
        assignDay in interface Scheduler
        Parameters:
        day - Day being processed
        errorCount - number of errors in current schedule
        complete - Tasks that are "finished scheduling" are added here
        taskManager - PriorityQueue of all Tasks in sorted order
        Returns:
        number of errors in scheduling Day

      • correctSchedule

        public boolean correctSchedule​(java.util.List<Day> schedule,
                               int errorCount)
        Description copied from interface: Scheduler
        Corrects schedule by eliminating all overflows via adjusting number of hours per day NOTE: This assumes that past days are stored in an archived list (thus, the first index of schedule is for today)
        Specified by:
        correctSchedule in interface Scheduler
        Parameters:
        schedule - list of days scheduled
        errorCount - number of errors currently in schedule
        Returns:
        boolean value if successful (e.g. would be false if there are more than 24 hours assigned for a task due today)
